net.rim.device.api.system
Class SerialPort

java.lang.Object
  net.rim.device.api.system.IOPort
      net.rim.device.api.system.SerialPort
Deprecated. The serial port is no longer supported. 

public final class SerialPort
extends IOPort

Provides low-level access to the device's serial port.

You should avoid using this class in applications, as it is not portable. Rather, if you need to gain access to the serial port, use the CLDC Connector factory to serve a connection.

Constructor Detail

SerialPort

public SerialPort(int baud,
                  int dataBits,
                  int parity,
                  int stopBits,
                  int rxBufferSize,
                  int txBufferSize)
           throws IOException
Deprecated. 
Constructs a new SerialPort object, opening the default port.

Building this object also allocates serial and transmit buffers in memory, and enables the serial driver, as well as hardware serial line drivers.

We recommend that you always close the port when you're not using it, as the hardware line drivers consume extra power while the port is open.

Parameters:
baud - Baud the serial port should use.
dataBits - Number of bits to use for data (7 or 8).
parity - Parity method to use; one of SerialPort.PARITY_NONE, SerialPort.PARITY_EVEN, SerialPort.PARITY_ODD.
stopBits - Number of stop bits to use (1 or 2).
rxBufferSize - Receive buffer size. This parameter is deprecated; the receive buffer size is fixed at 2048 bytes.
txBufferSize - Transmit buffer size. This parameter is deprecated; the transmit buffer size is fixed at 2048 bytes.
Throws:
IOException - If the port could not be opened.

Determines if the device has a serial port.

stopBits - Number of stop bits to use (1 or 2).
Throws:
IOException - Thrown if the port is not currently open.

standbyMode

public void standbyMode(boolean state)
                 throws IOException
Deprecated. 
Toggles standby mode state.

In standby mode, the port is kept open, but the serial drivers and processor go into suspend mode. The invoker must already have the port open, and must remember to invoke this method with false before using the port again.

Parameters:
state - If True, put port into standby mode; if False, wake port up from standby mode.
Throws:
IOException - Thrown if the port is not currently open.

close

public void close()
Deprecated. 
Closes the serial port.

Invoking this method closes this port, disables the line drivers, and frees any buffer memory that was allocated when the port was opened.

The system automatically invokes this method when the device is shut off. Applications may not assume that the port is still open once the device is powered on again.

Specified by:
close in class IOPort

write

public int write(byte[] data)
          throws IOException
Deprecated. 
Places bytes to send into the transmit buffer.

Note that after calling this method, you must wait for the IOPortListener.dataSent() method to be invoked before writing additional data.

Specified by:

Parameters:

Returns:
Number of bytes placed in the buffer.
Throws:
IOException - If the port is not currently open.

write

public int write(byte[] data,
                 int offset,
                 int length)
          throws IOException
Deprecated. 
Places some bytes to send into the transmit buffer.

Note that after calling this method, you must wait for the IOPortListener.dataSent() method to be invoked before writing additional data.

Use this method to place only a portion of a byte array into the transmit buffer.

Specified by:
write in class IOPort
Parameters:
data - Bytes array containing data to send.
offset - First data byte from array to send.
length - Number of data bytes to send.
Returns:
Number of bytes actually placed in the buffer.
Throws:
IOException - If the port is not currently open.

read

public int read(byte[] data,
                int offset,
                int length)
         throws IOException
Deprecated. 
Reads some data bytes from the receive buffer.

Invoke this method to stuff only a portion of your data buffer with bytes from the receive buffer.

Specified by:
read in class IOPort
Parameters:
data - Buffer to contain the received bytes; to flush the receive buffer, pass null.
offset - Position from the start of the buffer to begin stuffing bytes from the receive buffer.
length - Maximum number of bytes to read.
Returns:
Actual number of bytes placed in the receive buffer.
Throws:
IOException - If the port is not currently open.

registerNotifyPattern

public static void registerNotifyPattern(byte[] pattern)
Deprecated. 
Registers a pattern to look for on the port.

While DTR is active, the port is monitored at 9600 baud 8N1. If the specified pattern occurs, the system sends a pattern notify event to the applications (which must implement IOPortListener.patternReceived(byte[]) to handle).

Parameters:
pattern - Pattern to look for; the first byte must be non-zero, and the pattern must be four bytes in length.
Since:
BlackBerry API 4.0.0
